content: I'm also test-deploying some experimental work by @Brock Whittaker on a possible new style for the message recipient bars. Feedback appreciated! (Both high-level, on how it compares to what we have now, which may best be in reactions to this message), as well as more nitpicking stuff.

(I expect most folks will experience some visual challenge during the first several hours using this, because everyone's brain is wired to detect the old style of recipient bars; so I'm especially interest in feedback on things like how easy content is to detect visually after folks have used this a bit)
I like it more than the other one that was experimentally deployed before

I don't like the completely different styling we use for stream.
On this very page I am writing I see:

  • on the left, purple # and normal colored stream name
  • on top, square background in purple, inverted stream name, font is different
  • recipient bars & headers - rounded corners, different font, topic is bold
  • just above this input - purple border, normal fonts, weird >

After using it for a bit, I like the direction, though maybe 70% of this direction would be optimal for me.

  • The new blue box is too prominent / distracting for me
  • I feel less able to skim through a stream; I think the boxing around the previous recipient blocks was important for visually chunking the conversations. I think I'd probably be fine with e.g. a thin line for the recipient bar rather than the full width bar
on the plus side I think it is successful on the front of looking much cleaner / more modern, so overall I'd be up for iterating on this a few times

Yeah, I think what I'd be interested in trying is:

  • Drawing a line across the top of the recipient bar or something (encapsulating the "Today" area).
  • Removing the background on the new blue box, but maybe keeping the new color? I think the new color does look nicer.
  • Putting the # next to "design" in the stream boxes.
  • Obviously, we'll need to adjust how the compose area looks to correspond; but I'd like to not get distracted with that for now.
  • We can try removing the bold in the recipient bars, though I think that actually does have usability value (the topic is usually the most important thing we want to draw your eyes to)

I suggest the pill to be the whole column width. This looks better as a separator and a sticky header:
Screen-Shot-2018-02-21-at-19.44.43.png
My only concern about that is whether the double-colored-line would look wrong. Easy to check.
Possibly adding an accent to the top or bottom of a section with the stream color could help a lot!
BTW, as a separate mini-project, you can investigate using the position: stickyfor headers. Supported on most modern browsers and make the sticking better.
yeah, if we're going to add two lines, my preference would be to add a line at the bottom of a section
I really like the look of the new recipient bars.
I am mostly neutral on the pointer but I slightly favor the old blue outline with no shading.
